title: vena_(cyborg_009)
body:
Vena is a character from the series Cyborg 009: The Cyborg Soldier, she is one of the 5 princesses of the Yomi Kingdom.
Physically, she looks just like her sisters, with short, bristly orange-red hair and bright, solid-colored eyes with no visible sclerae or pupils, only Vina has green eyes.
In dress, she is distinguished by her tiara has a blue gem, blue jumpsuit and red shoes.
Vena stands out among her sisters for her strong and serious character, contrasting with her older sister, Helen.

title: west_virginia_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleship USS [i]West Virginia[/i] (BB-48) in [[Azur Lane]].

h4. Appearance
Her original design by [[Rail (Silverbow)]] (post #2975385) portrays her with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[orange eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[peaked cap]], eye[[glasses]], [[black gloves]], a white top, [[black dress]], [[miniskirt]], and [[garter straps|garter strap]] [[thighhighs]].
Her rig consists of two sides, each with two 406 mm twin mounts and a funnel.

Her revised design by [[Chuzenji]] (post #3297426) radically changes her form, now sporting [[pale skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], and [[red eyes]].
Her outfit was changed to a [[black jacket]] strapped around a [[black dress]] and a secondary white outer dress, while her [[black gloves]] remain intact from the original. She also wears black [[rudder footwear]].
Her rig was also changed to better reflect the real-life namesake, with two 406 mm twin mounts per side and her cage mast and CXAM [[radar]] holding the two sides together.

h4. History
In real life, [i]West Virginia[/i] was among the battleships sunk in Pearl Harbor, moored outboard of [[Tennessee (Azur Lane)|]] and thus took the brunt of the damage. Refloated in May 1942, she was modernized in the West Coast in a style similar to the Tennessee-class: turning their superstructures into a compact form reminiscent of [[South Dakota (Azur Lane)|]]. Unlike the two Tennessee-class ships, the scale of her damage and modernization meant she only reentered active service in mid-1944, in time for the battle of Leyte Gulf. Here, she led the battle line that engaged "Nishimura's fleet":/pools/9549 in the last battleship-to-battleship engagement in history, firing the opening shots against [[Yamashiro (Azur Lane)|]] from 20.8 km out and Mogami from Artillery bombardment, knocking the Heavy Cruiser out of action.

Later seeing service in Iwo Jima and Okinawa, she was decommissioned in 1947 and scrapped 12 years later.

title: estoc_(weapon)
body:
A type of long, slender thrusting [[sword]] with a cruciform hilt and a grip for two-handed use, used in the late Medieval and Renaissance period. Essentially a type of highly specialized [[long sword]], the blade of an estoc is very stiff and usually has a diamond-shaped cross section. Because any edge on an estoc's blade is usually vestigial, it is unsuited to cutting but excels at thrusting and as an anti-armor weapon.

h4. See also
* [[Longsword]]

title: xenogears
body:
JRPG developed and published by Squaresoft (now Square Enix) for the Sony [[Playstation 1]]. Released on February 11, 1998 in Japan and on October 21, 1998 in North America.

It is part of the Xeno metaseries alongside [[Xenosaga]] and [[Xenoblade Chronicles (series)|]].

The story follows the protagonist [[Fei Fong Wong]] and several others in a journey to overthrow the rule of Solaris, an advanced tyrannical society floating in the sky. The game features [[mecha]] called Gears.

title: shirahoshi
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Princess Shirahoshi is a [[giantess|giant]] smelt-whiting [[mermaid]] and the princess of the Fish-Man Island.

The daughter of [[neptune_(one_piece)|Neptune]] and [[otohime_(one_piece)|Otohime]], she has three older brothers; [[Fukaboshi]], [[Ryuuboshi]] and [[Manboshi]] as well as a pet shark [[Megalo]].

[spoiler]Unbeknownst to her and those around her, she is the modern incarnation of "Poseidon", one of the three Ancient Weapons that is said to be capable of destroying the world. "Poseidon" being the power of communicating and controlling the Sea Kings, gigantic and powerful sea creatures.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Fandom: Shirahoshi":http://onepiece.fandom.com/wiki/Shirahoshi

title: charlotte_pudding
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Pudding is the 76th child of [[Charlotte Linlin|Big Mom]], an officer of the Big Mom Pirates, and a hybrid between a human and a member of the Three-Eye Tribe.

She is initially arranged to be married with [[Sanji (one piece)|]] as a part of the regicide plan against the Vinsmoke family, but ended up genuinely fallen in love with him for real in the events of Whole Cake Island Arc.

Her most defining feature is her [[third eye]] on her forehead, which is usually covered by her bang. 

Having consumed the Memo Memo no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can turn people's memories into strips of film and manipulate them.

title: g10n_fugaku
body:
An [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] ultra-long range heavy bomber project developed during [[World War II]]. As with other bombers, it received mountain-related name, in this case the plane was named after [[Mount Fuji]].

The plane was designed as a part of Project Z, a project of the IJN to develop a heavy bomber capable of reaching the American mainland (much like Germany's "own project":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heinkel_He_277] and, inversely, [[XB-35|the]] [[B-36 Peacemaker|American's]]). Due to the lack of materials and worsening war situation of Japan, the project was ultimately cancelled in 1944.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nakajima G10N":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_G10N]

title: luigi_di_savoia_duca_degli_abruzzi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian cruiser [i]Luigi di Savoia Duca degli Abruzzi[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]] top with [[armpit cutout]]s and an [[aiguillette]], [[white shirt|white]] undershirt for the bust, [[red skirt]], [[red boots|red]] [[knee boots]], and [[white gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with the [[Regia Marina]]'s red-white stripes, four 152 mm triple/twin mounts, and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

Her Hunt/Xianzhou outfit consists of a [[black dress]] worn with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white dress]] layer, [[red jacket|red]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black gloves]], [[pink sash]], [[white bloomers]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[black boots|black]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[official alternate hairstyle]] in this outfit is a [[shuangyaji]].

title: gregory_house
body:
Gregory House is a fictional character and the titular protagonist of the American medical drama series [[house m.d.|House]]. Created by David Shore and portrayed by English actor Hugh Laurie.

Head of the Department of Diagnostic Medicine at Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital, with specialties in both Infectious Disease and Nephrology. House did his undergrad at Johns Hopkins; he also attended medical school there but was expelled for cheating and ultimately got his degree from the University of Michigan. House is a brilliant doctor; unfortunately for everyone around him, he's also a misanthrope and an arrogant jerk to everyone he meets. He walks with a [[cane]] as a result of an infarction he suffered in his right thigh and the surgery that tried to correct it; the pain from this drives his Vicodin addiction as well.

[[Italy|Italian]] [[noodles]] made out of unleavened dough of wheat flour mixed with water and sometimes egg.

title: sdf-2_megaroad-01
body:
A massive [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA from 1987.

The [[U.N. Spacy]] [b]SDF-2 Megaroad-01 Class Super-Long Range Colonization Ship[/b] was originally going to be a bigger and better armed version of the [[SDF-1|SDF-1 Macross]]. However, after the end of [[choujikuu yousai macross|Space War I]] the ship was redesigned as the first of a series of massive colonization craft developed for the program of expansion of human civilization and culture across the [[galaxy]].

The SDF-2 can't transform and was designed with various minimal armaments to ensure more space was available for colonists and bigger life support systems. However, a large complement of [[mecha]], which included several [[destroid]]s and the brand new [[VF-4]] variable fighters, were onboard the new vessel. Also, a defense [[fleet]] composed of many Earth and [[Zentradi]] warships provided escort for the Megaroad. The Megaroad class ships were eventually succeded by the bigger and more advanced [[city 7|City Class Starships]]. 

The SDF-2 Megaroad-01 was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 1980s.

title: uraga_class_carrier
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction anime series.

The [b]Uraga Class Escort Battle Carrier[/b] is the next generation stealth carrier built to replace the GuantÃ¡namo Class Stealth Carriers in the Earth's military forces. 

The Uraga Class, built with weaponry, armor and maneuverability comparable to a cruiser, is often used as the flagship of small [[U.N. Spacy]] and [[N.U.N.S.]] fleets. 

At 550 meters long, the Uraga Class ships are much larger conventional spacecraft but still significantly smaller than the [[SDF-1|SDF-1 Macross]] or the later New Macross Class ships. The Uraga is built with a stealth composition superstructure and features a dual deck launching system for [[variable fighter]]s; one deck running the latter dorsal two-thirds of the ship and an internal deck underneath with a launching deck in the forward third. This efficient deck design allows rapid deployment of multiple craft simultaneously and has become common on many UN Spacy carrier vessels.

These ships are rare among colonization fleets due to their high costs compared to the [[ARMD]] carriers but the U.N.G. remains committed to replacing the older ARMD carriers one by one with Uraga Class ships. As more Uraga Class Escort Battle Carriers are built, they are poised to become the mainstay combat and carrier ship for the U.N. Spacy. Many Uraga Class vessels are part of the Earth's defense fleet and are found serving as command ships for large groups of [[Guantanamo Class Stealth Carrier]]s and [[Northampton Class Stealth Frigate]]s. Several Uraga Class Escort Battle Carriers are also in active service as defensive stations docked to unarmed core ships.

In real life this ship was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

title: macross_scrambled_valkyrie
body:
[b]ChÅ JikÅ« YÅsai Macross: Scrambled Valkyrie[/b] is a 16-megabit, 2D shooter released on the [[Nintendo]] [[Super Famicom]] in 1993 and based on the 1984 animated movie The Super Dimension Fortress [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] 

The story takes place after the movie's ending but before the launch of the [[SDF-2 Megaroad-01]]. 

The game was developed by WinkySoft and published by Zamuse. It was only released in Japan.

title: macross_flashback_2012
body:
[b]The Super Dimension Fortress[/b] [[Macross]] [b]Flash Back 2012[/b] is a 1987 OVA collection of music videos from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] animated television series (1982-1983) and [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|: Do You Remember Love?]] theatrical film adaptation (1984). 

It also contains several minutes of new footage (with new [[mecha]], [[spacecraft]] and costume designs) that depicts story events that were initially planned but not animated for the endings of the television series (the launch of the [[SDF-2 Megaroad-01]] colonization ship captained by [[Hayase Misa]]) and the film (the final concert on Earth by [[Lynn Minmay]]).

h4. See also

title: brisket
body: A tough but incredibly flavorful cut of beef from the cow's chest. Its toughness is its strength, as it requires low and slow cooking methods to break down the connective tissue, resulting in incredibly tender, juicy, and flavorful meat that is a centerpiece of many cuisines, especially barbecue.

title: passover
body: A major Jewish festival that commemorates the Biblical story of the Israelitesâ€™ Exodus from slavery in ancient Egypt. This story is recorded in the Hebrew Bibleâ€™s Book of Exodus. The holiday begins on the 15th day of the Hebrew month of Nisan and lasts for seven days in Israel (and among some liberal Jewish communities worldwide), or eight days in many traditional communities outside of Israel.

title: saria_(arknights)
body:
[i]Saria, former researcher of Rhine Lab, will serve as a core part of the squad's defense and healing unit on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]April 23[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]174 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Saria was once the director of the [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]] Defense Division, has made contributions to the fields of life science, microbiology, and Originium Arts and has also proven herself formidable when it comes to demolition, protection, and anomaly containment missions. She is currently working with Rhodes Island in various scientific fields and is negotiating a more in-depth cooperation plan with them.

Parted ways with Rhine Lab, LLC after a certain incident involving [[Ifrit (Arknights)|]] and her former colleague, [[Silence (Arknights)|]], with the latter ensuring Saria and Ifrit do not get the chance to interact with each other.

One of the supporting characters in the side story event [i]Mansfield Break[/i]. Uses calcification arts in addition to her healing and defensive capabilities.

Her motif is based on a Western dragon. Her callsign is derived from the mythical name of the "gray-haired mountain" Mount Hermon, located between the border of present-day Syria and Lebanon.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Iguchi Yuka]].

An ex-Originium researcher at [[Rhine Lab (Arknights)|Rhine Lab, LLC]]. She was involved in several unknown applied research projects as well as several clinical trials on oripathy there, with [[Ifrit_(Arknights)|Ifrit]] as her test subject. After a horrendous incident at the lab, she left Rhine Lab and took Ifrit into her care and brought her to Rhodes Island, which possessed the only other facilities outside of Rhine Lab capable of containing an Oripathy case as seemingly severe as Ifrit's. She now provides battlefield medical treatments to Rhodes Island.

She deploys medical [[drone|drones]] in battle. Her motif is based on owls, specifically the [i]Great Horned Owl[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kitou Akari]].

title: tyson_hesse
body:
American illustrator, comic artist, and animator, known for his prolific artistic contributions to official [i][[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]][/i] media. Created a [i]Sonic[/i] fan comic, titled [i]Sonic's Big Fat Adventure[/i], which earned him a position as an artist for the official [i]Sonic[/i] [[sonic the hedgehog (archie comics)|comic series]] published by Archie Comics. Has since served as artist and animation director for several [i]Sonic[/i] cartoon shorts, and became the character design lead for the [[Sonic (live action)|live-action]] film series following the negative reception to the [[Ugly Sonic|initial design]] of the first film's version of [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]].

title: hiei_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Hiei[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] [[flipped hair|flipped back]], and [[purple eyes]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt]]s (hers is [[green skirt|green]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]].

She tends to be depicted as a fiery airhead girl who usually can be seen worshiping [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], her big sister. This leads to her frequently being portrayed as a lesbian, siscon, and at odds with the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]], either being indifferent to his presence or holding a deep, perhaps one sided rivalry with him due to her sister's unrelenting admiral love.

Her "{{pool:13812|Hiei Curry}}" featured in her hourlies, whether it is good or [[bad food|bad]] (usually the latter), is infamous for making the admiral run away for several hours. Oftentimes, her cooking is plain [[censored food]]. Has a tendency to yell out "Hieee-!" (written "ã²ãˆãƒ¼ï¼" or with a typographical variant), which sounds like her own name.

title: kamen_rider_zx
body:
The tenth [[Kamen Rider]] introduced during an anniversary TV special. His name is pronounced as "Zee-Cross".

After being abducted when his plane crashes, Ryou Murasame is made into the Badan Empire's agent of evil known as ZX until he suffers an accident that undoes his brainwashing. He escapes from Badan, encountering senior Riders. He is reluctant to trust them at first, but eventually joins them to destroy the Badan Empire, giving himself the name of Kamen Rider ZX.

ZX is based on a long-horn beetle and mostly colored red and white with a green scarf.

title: euphemism
body:
When an offensive, harsh or blunt expression is replaced with a mild, indirect or vague one. 

Visual euphemisms exist, too, such as the one used for [[Akiyama Mio]]'s accidental [[pantyshot]] in the [[K-On!]] anime (a stripped bowl of rice) or when [[swastika]] or the [[hammer and sickle]] are replaced with more innocuous symbols to avoid offending the audience and/or so the work won't run afoul of laws banning the public display of either symbols.

An orthographic euphemism is spelling a word deliberately wrong (e.g. "porn" becomes "pr0n", "n0rp" or "prawn") to circumvent censorship algorithms on the usenet, websites, social media apps, etc.

h4. Examples

* !post #8019284

h4. See also

* [[double entendre]]
* [[pun]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Unusual Euphemisms":[http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnusualEuphemism]

title: murasame_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Murasame[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class' [[school uniform]]: a [[black_serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]], [[black socks]], and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of her funnel to her back, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount slung to the side, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. Unlike the rest of her class however, she wields a melee weapon, that being a chained anchor that she utilizes as a [[flail]].

She has a very girly personality while being the most physically mature person among her sister ships. Has a habit of beginning her sentences with "hai hai" (ã¯ã„ã¯ãƒ¼ã„).

title: dotsuitare_hompo
body:
A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]] that represents the Osaka division. It consists of the members [[Nurude Sasara]] (a comedian), [[Amayado Rei]] (a conman whose true identity is [spoilers]the father of the [[buster_bros!!!|Yamada brothers]] and the inventor of the Hypnosis Mic technology[/spoilers]), and [[Tsutsujimori Rosho]] (a teacher).

Sometimes referred to as Dotsuitare [i]Honpo[/i].

body: A three member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]] that represents the Ikebukuro division. It consists of the [[brothers]] [[Yamada Ichiro]], [[Yamada Jiro]], and [[Yamada Saburo]].

title: halfling
body:
A humanoid race found in a number of [[fantasy]] settings, most notably [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. They're physically similar to humans, except about half as tall and not as stocky as the similarly sized [[dwarf|dwarves]]. They tend to be portrayed as stealthy and lucky.

Their general description and traits are typically derived from the hobbit race found in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

h4. See also

* [[Dwarf]]
* [[Elf]]
* [[Gnome]]
* [[Orc]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Halfling":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halfling

title: dwarf
body:
A fantasy race of short, stocky humanoids. Classically depicted as resembling tiny old men, generally bearded. They are commonly associated with metalwork and mining.

Only apply this tag if the character depicted features the defining characteristics of a dwarf, such as significantly short stature (typically around child's height), bulky build relative to the height, etc.

h4. See also

* [[draph]]
* [[gnome]]
* [[halfling]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: sharpnelsound
body: The record label/doujin circle of DJ Sharpnel, a [[j-core]] duo. Their logo is a yellow S with a blue outline.

title: j-core
body:
Japanese hardcore techno scene associated with doujin music and rhythm games. Pioneered in the late 90s and early 2000s by duo [[sharpnelsound|DJ Sharpnel]], derived from the earlier [[Nerdcore Techno]] genre that J-core would come to overshadow. Today, J-core is popular around the world due to its use in games and online.

This tag should be used on posts that reference j-core artists, circles, songs or albums.

h4. See also

* [[Camellia (musician)|]]
* [[hardcore tano c|HARDCORE TANO*C]]
* [[t+pazolite]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: J-core":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J-core

title: vip_sensei_(meme)
body:
A Japanese [[meme]] based on a video of the [[Maschinenmensch]] from [[Metropolis (Fritz Lang)|]] dancing to a remix of a [[Super Mario RPG]] song. The video was originally posted by a Spanish blogger in 2005, before it caught the attention of VIPPERs from [[2channel]], who misheard the lyric "drives some peeps insane" as "VIP sensei".

h4. External links

title: pain_elemental
body:
Floating [[demon]]s from [[DOOM (series)|]] with an appearance and shape similar to [[Cacodemon]]s. Brown, [[one-eyed]], [[sharp teeth]] and distinguished with having [[red sclera]] and arms. They infinitely throw [[Lost soul (doom)|]]s at the player as long as the player is in sight. Uniquely lacks a corpse when killed in [[Doom II]], and cannot be resurrected by [[Arch-vile]]s.

In [[Doom 64]], their appearance changes rather drastically but functions the exact same.

title: doom_ii
body:
Sequel to the first [[DOOM I|DOOM]]. [[Doomguy]] fights off the invading demons on Earth, and ends it by defeating the [[Icon of Sin]]. The game features no changes from the first- but has new enemies and introduces the [[double-barreled shotgun|super shotgun]] to the player's arsenal. Most .wads utilize this version of Doom.

body: Tall and powerful [[demon]]s from [[DOOM (series)|]] capable of [[pyrokinesis|setting the player on fire]] at long ranges and resurrecting dead monsters, or summoning them in [[Doom Eternal]].

title: sasaki_kanna
body:
An [[original|original character]] in the [[Gaki Kyonyuu]] series by [[kaedeko_(kaedelic)|Kaedeko]].

She's an elementary school student often described as [[oppai_loli|big breasted kid]]. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] styled in [[twintails]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She is seen mostly wearing either a [[yellow camisole]] or [[crop top]] and [[shorts]]. Her older sister is [[Sasaki Miyuki]], her mother is [[Sasaki Kei]] and she is classmates with [[Lady Flat Chest (gaki Kyonyuu)|]].

title: cutter_(arknights)
body:
[i]Cutter, mercenary, will complete all tasks on the battlefield in a calm and disciplined manner.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile

[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 2[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vulpo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Cutter, a mercenary who has long been active in the fringes of Columbiaâ€™s controlled territories, has come seeking medical treatment. She has shown excellent close-quarters combat capabilities across several operations. She currently serves in one of Rhodes Islandâ€™s Guard squads, having participated in many VIP escort jobs among others.

She has [[red eyes]], short [[grey hair]], and has [[bandaid|bandaids]] to cover cuts on her body. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|red sleeveless shirt]], a [[black jacket]] on her shoulders and a [[black skirt]]. Her motif is based on the red fox, and she has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]]. 

Her voice actors are [[Yahagi Sayuri]] (JP), Su Wan (CN), Kristen Li (EN) and Esther Won (KR). Her original art designer is [[xiayehongming]], while her [b]Wiping Knife[/b] outfit is drawn by [[baimudafeiyu]].

title: nijiyon
body:
A spinoff of [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] that started out as a [[4koma]] series drawn by [[Miyako Hito]].

Season 1 spans chapters 1 to 60 and can be found at the [[Love Live! School Idol Festival ALL STARS]] website.

Season 2 continues the series up to chapter 110 and can be found at the [[Dengeki G's]] website.

Season 3, unlike the previous seasons, is a motion comic with background music and voice acting. It ran every Tuesday from June 2, 2020 to December 29, 2020 on the official YouTube channel.

Season 4 continues from Season 3 and introduces [[mifune shioriko|Shioriko]], [[mia taylor|Mia]], and [[zhong lanzhu|Lanzhu]] to the cast. It ran from July 6, 2021 to January 18, 2022 on the official YouTube channel.

An anime based on the series called Nijiyon Animation premiered on January 6, 2023. A second season has started airing on April 5, 2024.

Use this tag when the post references events that have happened in the series.

h4. See also
* pool #24042: Nijiyon Plus

h4. External Links

* "Season 1":[https://lovelive-as.bushimo.jp/comic/]
* "Season 2":[http://gs.dengeki.com/web_rensai/niziyon/]
* "Season 3":[https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYpy4kJmEo77AEmJnFbKONWZu_vVz0I7Q]
* "Season 4":[https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYpy4kJmEo75Z4kuXQy-e5fFmCoMPRlyE]

title: ruqun
body:
Ruqun (è¥¦è£™) is a set of attire in [[hanfu]] which consists of a short [[jacket]] worn under a [[long skirt]].

An [[aoqun]] is the opposite; hanfu where the top is worn over the skirt (not tucked in). 

Ruqun is however a very broad term, an umbrella term for any kind of hanfu wherein the top is tucked into the skirt. Try to use one of the more specific terms below.  Use [[ruqun]] when none of the below categories apply.

h4. Examples of the types

* !post #5853636: [[Duijin Ruqun]]
* !post #7555480: [[Jiaoling Ruqun]]
* !post #7575774: [[Qixiong Ruqun]]
* !post #8266560: [[Tanling Ruqun]]

h4. Types

* [[Duijin ruqun]] (å¯¹è¥Ÿè¥¦è£™, a ruqun with parallel collar jacket) ("| |" or "V" shape)
* [[Jiaoling ruqun]] (äº¤é¢†è¥¦è£™, a ruqun with crossed collar jacket) ("y" shape) 
* [[Qixiong ruqun]] (é½èƒ¸è¥¦è£™, a ruqun with chest-high skirt)

title: sokutai
body:
Japanese court apparel worn by courtiers, aristocrats, and the Japanese emperor during the Heian period. Though no longer worn as everyday clothing, the outfit is still used for especially formal occasions such as weddings and enthronement ceremonies. Not to be confused with [[kariginu]].

The outfit consists of several parts, most notably the [i]kanmuri[/i] ([[tate eboshi]]), [i]hou[/i] (an outer [[robe]]), and [i]shaku[/i] (a [[ritual baton]]).

title: kakine_teitoku
body:
Academy City's 2nd Ranked Level 5 esper from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. His ability is known as [[Dark Matter (kakine teitoku)|]] (æœªå…ƒç‰©è³ª, Migen Busshitsu lit. "Unknown Matter"). He often uses his powers to construct six large feathered [[white wings]] made of Dark Matter, giving him an [[angel wings|angel]]-like appearance, ironic considering he's arguably the most evil of all the Level 5s.

He has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[brown eyes]], and usually wears a [[purple suit|purple]] / [[brown suit|brownish]] [[suit]] with [[pants]] and a [[jacket]] over an [[open shirt|open]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt|dress]] [[shirt]] over a [[red sweater|red]] [[sweater]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. He usually sports a [[expressionless|cool, stoic]], facial expression.

During the events of [[Toaru Majutsu no Index: New Testament]], Teitoku is defeated by a rogue beetle he created, which then proceeds to take over his appearance and powers, but is now a benevolent and kind person.

title: iaidou
body:
A school of Japanese swordsmanship that emphasizes quickly drawing one's sword and responding to sudden attacks, as well as constant awareness. It developed from iaijutsu, a quick-draw sword technique. The technique is most commonly depicted as quickly drawing, slashing, and sheathing a sword in one smooth motion.

title: chastity_cage
body:
A device that can be locked onto a person's [[penis]] to prevent the wearer from engaging in sexual contact. In many cases, it also makes erection uncomfortable or impossible. Also known as a penis cage. It is used as a [[sex toy]] as a method of erotic sexual denial.

Not to be confused with a [[chastity belt]], which serves a similar purpose, but wraps around the wearer's entire waist instead of just the penis. If the "belt" is a strap, band or chain connected to a chastity cage, use [[chastity cage strap]]. If it's really a chastity belt that is also a penis cage, use [[chastity cage-belt]].

h4. Related tags

h6. Main types

Most chastity cages can be tagged with 1 and only 1 of the tags below.

* [[flat chastity cage]] [tn]Small, flat and deeper than testicles.[/tn]
* [[nub chastity cage]] [tn]Small, round and symmetrical.[/tn]
* [[revealing chastity cage]] [tn]Made of metal rings, wires, straps, or an open frame / mesh that lets you see the penis inside the cage.[/tn]
* [[tube chastity cage]] [tn]Encases and hides the penis inside a tube.[/tn]

h6. Special types

* [[chastity cage-belt]] [tn]A chastity belt-shaped chastity cage.[/tn]
* [[double end chastity cage]] [tn]A cage for two.[/tn]

h6. Size

* [[small chastity cage]] [tn]Shorter than [[testicles]].[/tn]
* [[large chastity cage]] [tn]Longer and thicker, can fit a normal penis [[half-erect]] or fully erect inside.[/tn]

h6. Design

* [[ornate chastity cage]] [tn]A cage with a fancy design like [[bunny ears]].[/tn]
* [[padlocked chastity cage]] [tn]A cage with a [[padlock]] locking it. Could be a [[heart-shaped lock]].[/tn]
* [[chastity cage strap]] [tn]A belt, band or chain strapped to the cage circling around the waist that holds it in place.[/tn]
* [[ball splitter]] [tn]A strap that goes between the [[testicles]] making them bulge out.[/tn]
* [[inverted chastity cage]] [tn]A cage that pushes the penis into the crotch.[/tn]

h6. Colors

* [[metal chastity cage]]
* [[gold chastity cage]]
* [[colored chastity cage]]
* [[transparent chastity cage]] [tn]Glass-like.[/tn]

h6. Actions

* [[chastity cage emission]] [tn]When [[cum]] or [[precum]] is coming out of a chastity cage.[/tn]
* [[bulging in chastity cage]] [tn]When the tip or shaft of the penis is bulging out of holes in the cage.[/tn]
* [[unworn chastity cage]] [tn]A chastity cage on scene that nobody is wearing.[/tn]
* [[holding chastity cage]] [tn]Holding an unworn cage.[/tn]
* [[touching another's chastity cage]] [tn]Touching a cage worn by someone else with any body part. Use [[testicle grab]] or [[caressing testicles]] instead if it's not touching the cage.[/tn]
* [[touching own chastity cage]] [tn]Touching your own cage.[/tn]
* [[partially worn chastity cage]] [tn]A cage being removed or placed.[/tn]
* [[chastity cage visible through clothes]] [tn]A cage visible through clothes.[/tn]
* [[sex toy replacing penis]] [tn]When a [[dildo]] or [[strap-on]] is used instead of the character's [[penis]].[/tn]

h6. Other tags

title: gouf_custom
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 08th MS Team]] OVA from 1996.

[b]MS-07B-3 Gouf Custom[/b]

An updated version of the venerable [[Gouf]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] with a hybrid Gatling shield, a redone heat wire instead of the heavy heat rod, and improved versatility. An unit was famously piloted by Commander [[Norris Packard]] in Southeast Asia during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] against the fearsome 08th MS Team and their powerful [[ground_gundam|Gundam Ground Types]].

Also featured more recently in [[Gundam Requiem for Vengeance]].

title: hizack_custom
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]RMS-106CS Hizack Custom[/b]

It is a fire support variant of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Hizack]] [[mobile suit]]. Standard [[Earth Federation]] Hizack Customs are blue colored, while the Titans opted for the classic [[Zaku II]] green color scheme for their units. 

After The Gryps War some grey colored units were seen deployed by the [[Neo Zeon]] [[full_frontal|Sleeves]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington]] base.

title: at-st
body:
A fictional [[walker (robot)|]] mecha from the [[Star Wars]] [[Science Fiction]] series. It first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back]] film from 1980.

The [i]Kuat Drive Yards[/i] [b]All Terrain Scout Transport Walker[/b], also known as the [b]Chicken Walker[/b] or simply as the [b]AT-ST Walker[/b], was a small bipedal [[mecha]] used by the Galactic Republic during the late Clone Wars and, later and more extensively, the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] during the Galactic Civil War. 

The standard model was equipped with a chin-mounted double medium blaster cannon, a concussion grenade launcher on the starboard side of its head, two feet with claws, a blaster cannon on the port side and laser resistant armor. 

The AT-ST was designed to be a reconnaissance attack vehicle. It was lighter than its bigger brother, the [[AT-AT]], and could withstand standard blaster fire, but was vulnerable to heavy laser fire and missiles, as well as physical attacks to the legs and the sides of the cockpit. 

While initially designed for multiple terrains, it was later used in urban areas mostly, where it proved to be more effective as an infantry support unit.

The AT-ST was designed in the early 80s.

h4. See also
* [[Regult]] -  A mecha anime walker inspired by this unit.

title: metropolis_(fritz_lang)
body:
[b]Metropolis[/b] is a 1927 German expressionist epic [[science fiction]] silent drama film directed by "Fritz Lang":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Lang . He and his wife, Thea von Harbou, wrote the silent film, which starred Gustav FrÃ¶hlich, Brigitte Helm, Alfred Abel and Rudolf Klein-Rogge. Erich Pommer produced it in the Babelsberg Studios for Universum Film A.G. 

It is regarded as a pioneering work of the serious science fiction genre in movies, being among the first feature length movies of the genre ever made. It also has been considered a semi-[[cyberpunk]] film created many decades before the genre even began. 

Metropolis is set in a futuristic urban dystopia and follows the attempts of Freder, the wealthy son of the city's ruler, and Maria, a poor worker, to overcome the vast gulf separating the classes of their city. 

The movie was made in [[Germany]] during the "Weimar Period":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weimar_Republic]. Filming took place in 1925 at a cost of approximately five million Reichsmarks. The art direction draws influence from Bauhaus, Cubist and Futurist design.

Metropolis was met with a mixed reception upon release. Critics found it pictorially beautiful and lauded its complex special effects, but accused its story of naivetÃ©.

Numerous attempts have been made to restore the film since the 1970s. Music producer Giorgio Moroder released a truncated version with a soundtrack by rock artists such as [[Freddie Mercury]], Loverboy and Adam Ant in 1984. A new reconstruction of Metropolis was shown at the Berlin Film Festival in 2001, and the film was inscribed on UNESCO's Memory of the World Register in the same year, the first film thus distinguished. 

In 2008 a damaged print of Lang's original cut of the film was found in a museum in Argentina. After a long restoration process, the film was 95% restored and shown on large screens in Berlin and Frankfurt simultaneously on 12 February 2010.

h4. See also

* [[Maschinenmensch]]
* [[Metropolis]] ([[Tezuka Osamu]] manga and anime inspired by this film)

title: doraemon_(character)
body:
The titular character of [[Doraemon]]. A prototype blue "cat [[robot]]" from the 22nd century that helps [[Nobi Nobita]] escape his doomed life in the future by turning him from a lazy boy into a responsible man.

He is a fat, short-sized robot. With height, weight, and other stats at 129.3 cm/kg, tied with his birthday in Year/Month/Day format (2112/9/3).

He has a round-shaped head. His body is blue, with white on his face and stomach. He has a [[red nose]] and a "[[tail]]" which is red ball placed on a thin wire. He wears a [[red collar]] with a yellow [[jingle bell]]. Because of his overall appearance he is often mistaken for a [[tanuki]] or a [[raccoon]], which can makes him angry. 

He has a "Fouth Dimension Bag" on his stomach in which he carries various gadgets from the future. Some gadgets are helpful, while some others are destructive (including an [[armageddon bomb|atomic bomb]]) despite the fact that he was originally build as a "Friend and Baby-Walker Robot".

He's brought home by Nobita's great-great-grandson, named [[Nobi Sewashi]], as an "incomplete prototype robot" from a robot factory. Because of this, most of his basic features such infrared eyes and nimble cat feet do not function. 

He is overly afraid on rats, mice, and anything similar because his ears were bitten by rats. In contrast with rats and mice, he's very fond of [[dorayaki]]. He will occasionally get mad if he does not eat dorayaki for 2 or 3 days. He will do anything for dorayaki. Because of this, Nobita often bribes Doraemon with dorayaki in exchange for borrowing some gadget. 

Because of his popularity in and out of [[Japan]] he was officially named by the Japanese government as a [b]Cultural ambassador of modern Japan[/b]. He is also portrayed by Jean Reno and Bruce Willis in several Toyota and SoftBank commercials respectively, so you know he means business.

He is primarily voiced by [[Ooyama Nobuyo]] from 1979 to 2005.

h4. See also
* [[Dorami]] - Doraemon's sister figure
* [[Monodora]]

Due to restraints on mass cultivation, especially outside of Japan, cheap "wasabi" is typically made from the faster and easier growing horseradish which they dye green.  Horseradish is a relative of wasabi and is commonly referred to as "western wasabi" (è¥¿æ´‹ã‚ã•ã³) in Japan.

title: cortana
body:
The AI companion to the [[Master Chief]] in the [[halo (series)|numbered Halo games]]. 

Cortana is an experimental model physically and mentally based off of her creator, Dr. Catherine Halsey, who also created the [[SPARTAN (halo)|]] supersoldiers.

Cortana is a highly-intelligent individual with a dry sense of humor, and alongside Master Chief, the Arbiter, and Sgt. Avery Johnson, serves as one of the "faces" of the [i]Halo[/i] franchise.

Due to her popularity, [[Microsoft]] named an assistant AI featured in [[Windows 8]] onwards after Cortana.

title: master_chief
body:
The main player character in the numbered [[halo (series)|Halo]] games.

Officially known as [b]Master Chief Petty Officer John-117[/b], or simply "Master Chief", he is a supersoldier created by the United Nations Space Command known as a [[SPARTAN (halo)|]], tasked with performing operations that would be exceedingly difficult for unaugmented humans.

His most famous exploits came during the Human-Covenant War, in which he destroyed one of the titular Halo rings, assassinated one of the Covenant's leaders, and played a key role in stopping the parasite known as the Flood for good, among other heroic acts.

John is one of the most iconic video game characters in the Western world, with his distinctive appearance and gravelly voice, provided by Steven Downes.

title: spartan_(halo)
body:
The typical player characters in the [[halo (series)|Halo]] franchise. 

They are [[space marine]] super[[soldier]]s created by the United Nations Space Command, candidates are given extensive genetic and physical augmentations, and, starting from the second generation, their iconic MJOLNIR powered armor.

In-universe, the project initially started to create an elite force to quell a growing insurrection against the UNSC. Initial candidates were adult volunteers, but the first phase of the project was considered a failure. Eventually, under the lead of Dr. Catherine Halsey, the second generation would be approved, infamously seeing to the abduction of several dozen children from across human space settlements. These children would be indoctrinated and given much more extensive and invasive augmentations and would be deployed just in time for the Human-Covenant War. 

The SPARTAN-IIs would be the most famous and successful generation, eventually being supplemented by the cheaper SPARTAN III program, making use of war orphans and using them as "fire-and-forget" weapons in one-off high-risk operations that resulted in high casualties. After the war's conclusion, the program would come full circle and the SPARTAN-IVs would consist of adult volunteers undergoing a more refined augmentation process.

h4. See also

* [[Master Chief]]
* [[Spartan-B312]]

title: traditional_nun
body:
A traditional [[nun]]'s habit, specifically a traditional Christian style (Catholic, Orthodox, etc), as opposed to the fetishized, non-traditional nun habits typically seen in anime and fanart.

It consists at most of a [[long dress|long dress]] (that's black) with [[long sleeves]] and a [[guimpe]] (that's white), and typically stars the distinctive nun headdress (consisting of a [[wimple]]/[[coif]] [that's white], headwear bandeau [that's white], and [[veil]] [that's black], though it has become increasingly optional for some since the 20th century), and may also include a [[tabard]], underdress, and so on. The habit is typically white-on-black, with black the predominant color, but they can also be wholly white, or white-on-blue. Color can depend on the religious order which the nun is a part of (ex. Carmelites being white-on-brown). They can also be wholly black, which is the common choice for Orthodox nuns.

The traditional habit can be accentuated with minor additions, but not so much that it detracts from the basics (ex. [[Sister Claire]] and [[Double (skullgirls)|]] as opposed to [[Specter (arknights)|]] and [[Index (toaru majutsu no index)|]]), and some degree of modesty must be adhered to (ex. not too tight-fitting, no shortened dresses, no cutouts, no openings where they wouldn't normally be ala the chest area, no side slits which reveal skin or undergarment, no overtly sexual depictions of certain undergarments, etc).

h4. Examples

* !post #6716988: Wholly traditional
* !post #3752558: Without headdress
* !post #3432046: Minor flourishes

h4. See also

* [[nun]]

h4. External links

* "S.D. Cason Catholic Gallery: Top 12 Orders of Catholic Nuns and Sisters":https://sdcason.com/orders-of-catholic-nuns-and-sisters/

title: kamen_rider_delta
body:
Kamen Rider Delta is the third (and last in the TV series) Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_555|Kamen Rider 555]]. Delta has a black color scheme with white Photon Blood (blue when transforming) flowing through its body. Delta is patterned after a mantis and the Greek letter delta (Î”).

Delta is remarkable for being the first Rider Gear to be used by a female in a TV series ([[Kimura Saya]] being its off-screen main user, and later Abe Rina using it on screen for a brief moment), alongside [[Kamen Rider Kaixa]]. 

The Gear itself constantly switches hands, going from Saya to Kitazaki, the [[Dragon Orphnoch]], and then to Mihara Shuji, who proceeds to use it for most of the time, though other one-time users of Delta include the aforementioned Rina, [[Inui Takumi]], [[Kusaka Masato]] and Murakami Kyouji, the Rose Orphnoch.

title: ramen
body:
A type of Japanese wheat-flour [[noodles|noodle]] popular in East Asian cuisine, derived from Chinese 'lamian' noodles.

The noodle soup dish of the same name is made by serving ramen noodles in beef or fish broth that is flavored with soy sauce or miso, and topped with a variety of items such as [[char-siu]], [[seaweed]], [[heimuer]], [[narutomaki]], [[softboiled egg]], [[chopped spring onion]] and [[kamaboko]]. There are different flavor distinctions for ramen, such as shio (salty), tonkotsu (pork bone), shoyuu (soy), hiyashi (chilled) and miso.

title: suction_cups
body:
An object that uses the negative fluid pressure of air or water to adhere to nonporous surfaces, creating a partial vacuum. Suction cups are peripheral traits of some animals such as octopuses and squids, and have been reproduced artificially for numerous purposes. 

This tag refers to the suction cups actually found on cephalopods. For artificial cups or devices that function on the same principle, see the following: 

* [[breast pump]]
* [[milking machine]]
* [[nipple clamps]]
* [[suction cup dildo]]

title: pizza
body:
A round, baked flat bread that is typically covered in tomato sauce, [[cheese]], and other toppings such as [[pepperoni]] and [[chili pepper]] according to preference or culture. Usually sliced into eight triangular [[pizza slice]]s.

Modern pizza originated from the Neapolitan pizza from Naples, [[Italy]]. It is one of the most popular [[fast food]] in the world.

There are also dessert pizzas that use [[chocolate]], [[cream]], [[candy]] and other sweet ingredients to create a treat resembling pizza.

title: shigure_kai_san_(kancolle)
body:
The third remodel of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Shigure (kancolle)|]]. 

While originally hinted in the Kantai Collection 2023 Calendar and episode 7 of the [[Kantai_Collection (anime)|second Kancolle anime]], her in-game implementation took place after the anime ended. In her kai san, her uniform turns [[sleeveless]] and gains [[multicolored clothes|white vertical sides]] in a design reminiscent of [[Kawakaze Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kawakaze]] and [[Umikaze Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Umikaze's]]. Her [[serafuku]] turns into a [[black jacket]] that she wears [[off shoulder]], and also wears a [[white belt]] and black [[chest harness]]es. 

Her [[rigging]] at Kai San form still consists of her back-mounted 12.7 cm twin gun mount plus two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, but the PLAMATEA figure reveals that her back gun mount can be split into two halves bearing one gun each and held by joints.

title: variant_keine
body:
A monstrous and twisted version of [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] (particularly her [[kamishirasawa keine (hakutaku)|hakutaku form]]) from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

She's a giant and grotesque [[hakutaku]], covered in eyes, [[extra arms]], a large mouth on her "torso", and a long neck to her human head, with its face twisted into itself, appearing as a spiral.
Her face can be "untwisted" to reveal her face, identical to her normal counterpart.

title: variant_yuuka
body:
A monstrous, cruel, sadistic, and deviant version of [[Kazami Yuuka]] from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

Appears very similar to normal Yuuka, but with revealing, suggestive clothing and attached to an amalgamation of hostile flora, some of which seem to be sentient in their own right in some form. Most are differing types of [[carnivorous plant]]s, such as a [[venus flytrap]]-like plant monster and an oversized [[pitcher plant]]. Her "main" form is one of the few variants that look virtually identical to their normal counterpart.

title: variant_mokou
body:
A monstrous version of [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] that appears in Mokou Route 3 from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

Appears as a colossal, skeletal [[phoenix]]-human titan emanating a constant firestorm.
[spoilers]If killed, she resurrects back as a bird-like "infant" form (albeit still huge), before quickly returning to her full monstrous form.[/spoilers]

title: variant_youmu
body:
A corrupted and twisted version of [[Konpaku Youmu]] in [[Touhou Igyoukyo]] from a different world. Seldom seen outside of [[Sushi Yuusha Toro]]'s standalone art.

Looks like normal Youmu, but with an extra pair of arms and numerous, heavy scars all over her body. Her [[Konpaku Youmu (Ghost)|ghost]] half also has a sharp-toothed mouth and appears to have been impaled several times.

title: variant_reimu
body:
A twisted and evil version of [[Hakurei Reimu]] from [[Touhou Igyoukyo]] from another world.

Largely appears very similar to normal Reimu, but her face is a deformed [[yin yang]], with both smaller circles being black eyes and the division between the yin and yang being a toothy mouth. She also grows large metal needles off her back that are used as weapons. She only speaks in clicks and clattering, possibly due to the shape of her mouth.
[spoilers]Her "face" is speculated to be a mask, due in part to a non-canon spin-off comic where the variants are protagonists and also have to fight off corrupted doppelganger invaders.[/spoilers]

body:
An evil and twisted version of [[Kirisame Marisa]] from another universe, she was one of the main antagonists in [[Touhou Igyoukyo]].

Has large black irises, making her eyes appear almost entirely black and her face is unnaturally blackened with no visible mouth. [spoilers]She actually has a mouth, it becomes visible when she tears her own face flesh off to reveal it in one scene.[/spoilers]
Some interpret her whole body as also being blackened the same way as her face, but this is not the "official" design.

title: princess_leia
body:
Female protagonist of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|sci-fi]] and [[fantasy]] series, and main protagonist of the [[Star Wars: Leia Princess of Alderaan]] book series.

She is a leading member of the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] [spoiler]and [[Luke Skywalker]]'s younger twin sister[/spoiler]. Strong and beautiful, she catches the eye of [[Han Solo]] and an unlikely relationship blossoms between the two. 

She was played by the late American actress [[Carrie Fisher]] in the three original films from the 70s and 80s, and in [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] and [[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]] for the sequel trilogy.

title: commissioner_upload
body:
A work that was uploaded to Danbooru by the person who [[commission]]ed it.

If the work was received privately from the artist rather than being publicly posted, or that it is different from version publicly posted by the artist (such as having higher resolution, lack of censorship, watermark, etc.), then the source may be left blank, left as the filename, or description of where the commission was delivered. [[Non-web source]] tag may be applicable if the artist have not posted that version of the work online.

If the work was posted to another site by the commissioner, please use [[second-party source]] instead.

title: marida_cruz
body:
A character in [i][[Gundam Unicorn]][/i], [b]Marida Cruz[/b] was originally known as "[[puru_12|Ple Twelve]]", a clone of [[Elpeo Puru]]. Marida was awakened by [[Glemy Toto]] and fought with her sisters during the first [[Neo Zeon]] movement. 

After the fight with [[Chara Soon]] in U.C.0089.1.17, [spoiler]she was one of the only surviving clones and was later taken by slave traders. She was later sold into sex slavery, in a colony brothel. Although her handlers thought she was too young to be a prostitute, the Madam thought there are pedophiles that would be interested in such youth.[/spoiler] 

Before coming under the protection of [[Suberoa Zinnerman]], [spoiler]Marida experienced countless pregnancies and abortions and her body is scarred from the abuse of her brutal customers.[/spoiler] Afterwards, she was rescued and taken in by a [[Neo Zeon]] faction to become a [[mobile_suit|MS]] pilot once again.

title: gaen_izuko
body:
Gaen Izuko is a mentor and leader of sorts to the other "oddity" specialists in the [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]]: [[Oshino Meme]], [[Kaiki Deishuu]], [[Kagenui Yozuru]], and [[Teori Tadatsuru]], who also comprised her "Occult Research Club" in college. She has a reputation for being powerful and knowledgeable in the series, and her catch phrase is "I know everything".  She is the younger sister of [[Gaen Tooe]] and aunt of [[Kanbaru Suruga]].

Appearance-wise, she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that typically [[hair over one eye|covers one of her]] [[brown eyes]].  Her typical attire is hip-hop inspired, consisting of a [[green hat|green]] and [[white hat|white]] [[baseball cap]] as a [[hat]] (often [[sideways hat|worn sideways]]), a [[green shirt|green]] [[off shoulder|off]][[off-shoulder shirt|-shoulder]] [[t-shirt|t-]][[shirt]], [[red pants]], and dark [[red footwear|red]] [[flats]] for [[shoes]].  For accessories, she usually wears red [[prayer beads]], a yellow [[star (symbol)|star-shaped]] [[pendant]] [[necklace]], black [[wristband]]s, orange and yellow [[headphones]] (usually [[headphones around neck|around her neck]]), and carries multiple [[smartphone]]s.

title: harukawa_maki
body:
Character from [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]].

The Ultimate Child Caregiver. She was raised in an orphanage and often had to take care of the children younger than her there; despite this, she does not like children. A mostly coolheaded girl. Although she was initially shown as a primary character along with [[Momota Kaito]] and [[K1-b0]] in early promotional materials, neither of the three were the true protagonist.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] divided into [[low twintails]] by two [[red scrunchie|red]] [[hair scrunchie|hair scrunchies]]. Her [[school uniform]] is a red [[serafuku]] with a black [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], and wears [[red thighhighs]]. She has a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]].

[spoiler]At the end of Chapter 2, it is revealed that she is actually the Ultimate Assassin, using the title of Ultimate Child Caregiver as a cover to hide this.[/spoiler]

The [[clothes writing|writing]] on her capelet reads "ç•¢ç«Ÿæˆä½›", meaning "ultimate attainment of Buddhahood". She dons a pair of [[sandals]] with [[red socks]] while standing on her [[tiptoes]]. Originally a "jizou":[/wiki_pages/jizou] statue, she came to life and became a magician of the Forest of Magic. She's friends with [[kirisame marisa|Marisa]], who calls her "Naruko" by mistake at times. Her abilities let her control the life force of living things.

title: tewoarao-!
body:
A series of images in which beautiful girls, including anime characters, were used in [[poster (medium)|]]s produced by the Saitama prefectural government's medical maintenance division to promote the prevention of O-157 between 2001 and 2002.

Arguably the most notable posters produced during this time featured the characters of [[Azumanga Daioh]] illustrated by series creator [[Azuma Kiyohiko]] depicting [[Kasuga Ayumu]] looking [[looking at viewer|obliquely upward]] with both [[outstretched hand|hands stretched out]] [[outstretched arms|to the front]], with "æ‰‹ã‚’æ´—ãŠãƒ¼!" (Tewoaro-! - meaning "[[washing|Wash]] your hands!) inscribed with cute letters.

These were posted on public facilities in Saitama Prefecture, and in the [[bus]]es that traveled around the prefecture. Inspired by the public relations campaign, [[parody|parodies]] made with many characters have become popular on the [[Internet]]. In 2019, parodies of these posters made a resurgence due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

title: driver_(drive)
body:
The unnamed protagonist of the 2011 film [[Drive_(movie)|]], played by [[Ryan Gosling]].

The Driver's most iconic outfit is a [[white_jacket|white satin jacket]] with an embroidered gold [[scorpion]] on the back, accompanied with driving [[gloves]], skinny tight black [[jeans]] and light colored madison [[boots]]. He also carries a [[hammer]] for a weapon.

The Driver is known for being quiet, reclusive and emotionally isolated. His personality traits have been perceived as "relatable" by those who have watched the film, resulting in the Driver being lauded through internet discourse. Examples include memes and video edits of the film's scenes depicting the Driver as "literally me" to viewers. [[k_(blade_runner_2049)|Officer K]], another character [[Ryan Gosling]] has played in [[Blade Runner 2049]], also shares many similarities to the Driver, and are often featured together in memes along with other film characters Gosling has played over his career.

h4. See also

title: tashkent_(kancolle)
body:
A character from [[Kantai Collection]], introduced in the 2018 Winter Event. Based on the Soviet destroyer leader Tashkent.

h4. Appearance

She has wide [[brown eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied off into [[low twintails|low]] [[twintails]] with [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|hair bows]], wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[papakha]] with three [[star (symbol)|]]s on it, a [[torn scarf|tattered]] [[white scarf|white]] [[scarf]] and a [[ribbon trim|ribbon-trimmed]] [[blue shawl|blue]] [[shawl]] over a [[white jacket|white]] [[jacket]] and an [[anchor necklace]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[skirt]], a couple of [[black belt|black]] [[belt]]s, an [[untucked shirt|untucked]] [[red shirt]], [[brown pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]].

Her rigging includes a pair of [[ship turret|turrets]] and a pair of triple-tube [[torpedo tubes|torpedo launchers]].

In her appearance in the 2019 calendar (post #3431552), she is portrayed as significantly taller than [[hibiki (kancolle)|Hibiki]].

h4. Personality

In-game, she has a generically friendly and reliable personality. She consistently refers to the admiral and other shipgirls as "Comrades", conforming to the communist model. In fan-art, the fact that she was built in Italy is rarely shown unless this is directly refered to, often making her the zealous, "more communist than thou" character compared to newcomer [[hibiki (kancolle)|Hibiki]]/[[verniy (kancolle)|Verniy]] and imperial-era old guard [[Gangut (kancolle)|]]. On the opposite end, you can have "the sweetest Tashkent around":[/pools/14819].

h4. History

The Tashkent class of ships consisted of a single destroyer leader, built in Italy for the Soviet navy just before World War II. Three other ships were ordered but canceled before construction. The class is named after Tashkent, "the capital city":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tashkent] of the Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic (now Uzbekistan).

h4. Trivia

The real life destroyer Tashkent had a top speed of 43 knots, technically making her faster than [[Shimakaze (destroyer)|]] but slower than the French destroyer [[Le Terrible (destroyer)|Le Terrible]]. With that in mind, she is currently the fastest destroyer implemented in game.

h4. See also

* [[Tashkent (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Tashkent (Pacific)]]
* [[Tashkent (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tashkent-class destroyer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tashkent-class_destroyer]
* "Kancolle Wiki: Tashkent":[http://en.kancollewiki.net/Tashkent]
* "Kancolle Wikia: Tashkent":[http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Tashkent]

title: tsuruki_shizuka
body:
Shizuka Tsuruki is the leading main character from the [[Girls und Panzer]] spinoff, [[Girls und Panzer Ribbon no Musha|Girls und Panzer: Ribbon no Musha]]. 

Shizuka, [[Matsukaze Rin]], and [[Endou Haruka]] are students at Tatenashi High School. They represent the school in Tankathlon (a cousin of Tankery) under the banner of Team Centipede. Shizuka is not only the team's leader, but also serves as the commander, gunner, and loader of the team's sole vehicle, a red [[Type 97 Te-Ke|Type 97 Te-Ke tankette]].

She has [[tsurime|upward-angled]] [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] (or [[black hair|black]], depending on the artist). Her long bangs have been swept around in an unusual loop and kept in place with a [[large bow|large]] [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] tied into [[red bow|a]] [[hair bow|bow]], from which the series derives its name. She also has a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]]. Shizuka is most often found wearing either a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] or the full [[Tatenashi High School uniform]], along with [[loafers]] and [[brown pantyhose]]. However, she frequently slips off one of her shoes in battle "in order to non-verbally convey her directions to Rin":/posts/2227380.

On more than one occasion, she has gone into Tankathlon battles wearing a suit of classical [[Japanese armor]] and wielding a [[bow (weapon)|bow]].

Shizuka makes frequent use of the [[emblem]] of [[Takeda Shingen]]'s [[Centipede]] force, even to the point of making it her own team's emblem and decorating the Type 97 with the symbol.

Voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]] in the mobile game [[Girls und Panzer senshadou daisakusen!]].

title: yobou_banka
body:
Yobou Banka, also known by his moniker, the "Boy with goggles," is a minor character that is introduced in [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. An operative of Academy City's Dark Side organisation SCHOOL, he is the first member of the organization in their debut to be seen.

He has [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]] with [[sanpaku|small pupils and irises]]. He wears a ring-shaped [[headgear]] with [[electrodes]] as "goggles" around his forehead like a headband. His canonical character art features a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[shirt]], [[brown pants]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[sneakers]] for [[shoes]].

title: strip_game
body:
A party game where a group of people take turns playing and the loser at the end of each round has to [[undressing|strip]] as a penalty. Usually the game doesn't end until at least one player has lost enough clothing to be [[completely nude]].

It can also be the result of [[gambling]] where a person loses all their money and, in a desperate bid to win it back, starts literally betting the clothes off their back.

Specific types of strip games include [[strip poker]], [[strip mahjong]] and even [[rock paper scissors]].

Not to be confused with [[Twitter strip game]], a game played with the audience via votes.

title: usugumo_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Usugumo[/i]. Character designed by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by Moriyama Yurika. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a ponytail (tied with a red ribbon similar to Murakumo's tress ribbons) with swept bangs and long sidelocks as well as light [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], blue [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. However, since the first official picture of her was without her uniform, some fans drew her with an outfit intermediary or similar to [[murakumo (kancolle)|Murakumo]]'s outfit due to being part of DesDiv 12 like Murakumo. She is unusual in the way she was first revealed: in the lead-up for the 2020 [[Lawson]] campaign (which would end up being delayed due to the [[coronavirus pandemic|COVID-19 pandemic]]), wearing the uniform. Her [[rigging]] is also similar to the other Special-Types: a funnel-mast backpack set, 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a 12.7 cm Type A twin gun mount [[handgun]]. h4. title: mitsukoshi_(department_store)
body:
An international department store chain with headquarters in Tokyo.

Since its inception as a [[kimono]] store "[i]Echigoya[/i]", Mitsukoshi has been adopting innovative business methods, such as the world's first fixed-price cash sales, Japan's first "modern-style" department store, and "the collaboration with subculture":[http://mitsukoshi.mistore.jp/onlinestore/shops/kancolle/].

In April 2008, Mitsukoshi and [[Isetan_(department_store)|]] were merged and to form the Isetan Mitsukoshi group. Besides Japan, it currently has branches in Mainland China, Taiwan, and the Philippines. 

h4. External links

* "Nihombashi Mitsukoshi Main Store Official website":[https://cp.mistore.jp/global/en/nihombashi.html]
* "ISETAN MITSUKOSHI Official website":[https://cp.mistore.jp/global/en.html]

title: spam_(food)
body:
A [[canned food|canned]] spiced [[ham]] made by the Hormel company since 1937. Competing and generic brands sell their products under the generic term "luncheon [[meat]]."

Due to its low price and ease of preservation, it was regularly issued as a field ration to soldiers around the world, particularly the [[United States Army]] during [[World War II]], the [[Korean War]], and the [[Vietnam War]]. The meat would often end up within the communities where American forces were stationed and was incorporated into local dishes.  Examples include Okinawan poku tamago (pork & eggs) dishes, Korean budae-jjigae (Army base stew), and Hawaiian Spam musubi.

The meat's abundance and its reputation of its low quality spawned a slang for quantity over quality.

h4. See also

* [[spam (messaging)]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

title: gelatin
body:
A translucent and colorless powder derived from collagen inside animal skin and bones. It is added to water to firm it up and provide texture, and tends to jiggle if moved around.

This tag mostly refers to the jello [[dessert]], although it can also be used in cooking. Savory gelatin is referred to as aspic.

A similar food product derived from red algae is called [[agar]] jelly. It is commonly used in the Japanese dessert [[anmitsu (dessert)|]].

h4.See also

* [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]]
* [[pudding]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: cross-laced_sweater
body: A [[sweater]] design that incorporates lace-up or crisscrossed ties as a prominent decorative (and sometimes functional) feature. These laces may appear down the front, back, or along the sides of the sweater, typically threaded through eyelets or loops so that the laces create an â€œXâ€ pattern.

title: knit_sweater
body:
A type of garment made from interlocked loops of yarn that create a flexible, warm fabric. While the term â€œ[[sweater]]â€ refers generally to a knitted or crocheted upper-body garment, in common usage, a â€œknit sweaterâ€ usually highlights the specific construction methodâ€”knitting, where yarn is worked together in rows of loops.

Knit sweaters can feature a variety of patterns such as [[cable knit]]s, [[ribbed sweater|ribbing]], [[Aran sweater|Aran designs]], Fair Isle colorwork, and more. They also come in many silhouettesâ€”[[crew neck]], [[V-neck]], [[cardigan]], and [[turtleneck]], among others.

title: puyopuyo_fever
body:
The fifth installment in the [[Puyopuyo]] series, released as Puyo Pop Fever in the West. Introduced a brand new Fever mode, where players can make large, preset Puyo chains after filling an offset meter, and new patterns of three or four puyo instead of the traditional two. A entirely new universe and characters are also introduced in this game as well.

h4. Timeline

title: puyopuyo_7
body:

title: sega_32x
body:
The [b]Sega 32X[/b] is an add-on for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[video game]] console. It was distributed under the name [b]Super 32X[/b] (ã‚¹ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ãƒ¼32X [i]SÅ«pÄ SÄtÄ« Tsu Ekkusu[/i]) in Japan, [b]Sega Genesis 32X[/b] in North America, [b]Sega Mega Drive 32X[/b] in the PAL region, and [b]Sega Mega 32X[/b] in Brazil.

The 32X was designed to expand the power of the Mega Drive and serve as a holdover until the release of the [[Sega Saturn]]. Independent of the Mega Drive, the 32X utilizes its own ROM cartridges and had its own library of games. 

Unveiled at June 1994's Consumer Electronics Show, Sega presented the 32X as the "poor man's entry into 'next generation' games...". The product was originally conceived as an entirely new console by [[Sega]] of Japan and positioned as an inexpensive alternative for gamers into the fifth generation of game consoles, but at the suggestion of Sega of America, the console was converted into an add-on to the existing Mega Drive and made more powerful, with two 32-bit central processing unit chips and a 3D graphics processor. 

Despite these changes, the console failed to attract either developers or consumers as the Sega Saturn had already been announced for release the following year. In part because of this, and also to rush the 32X to market before the holiday season in 1994, the 32X suffered from a weak library of titles. With sales only reaching as high as 665,000 units, the 32X is still considered a commercial failure.

title: yu-gi-oh!_ocg_structures
body:
Japanese name: éŠâ˜†æˆ¯â˜†ç‹ ï¼¯ï¼£ï¼§ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼ã‚º
English romanization: [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] official card game SutorakuchÄzu

Yu-Gi-Oh! OCG Structures is a manga series. It is set in a real-world Tokyo, Japan. The manga began serialization on June 21, 2019, in the V Jump magazine. The manga is authored by [[sato masashi|Masashi SatÅ]], who previously did the artwork for the [[yu-gi-oh!_5d's|Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]] manga.
Unlike previous manga spin-offs, OCG Structures manga does not have an anime counterpart; however, characters from the Japan-only Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters Saikyo Card Battle make appearances. 

The manga is based around the real-world OCG rules, as well as set releases. No new card types are introduced, but due to the nature of the manga, any previous type can be the focus of the chapter, based on the Deck the Duelists have built. 

The series follows [[yusa_shoma|Shoma Yusa]], who moved to a big city from the deep countryside at the invitation of his older sister.

h4. External links
* "Yu-Gi-Oh! Wiki: OCG Structures":[https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Yu-Gi-Oh!_OCG_Structures]

title: kamen_rider_den-o
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_den-o_(series)|Kamen Rider Den-O]], seventeenth show in the Kamen Rider series and eighth of the Heisei generation.

Nogami Ryotaro is an extremely unlucky young man who happens to be a "Singularity Point" - he can exist outside his "home timeline" and be immune to permanent possession by Imagin, monsters who seek to alter history in their favor by offering a "contract" with discontented people. Having won the allegiance of 4 (later 5) Imagin, he transforms into Den-O.

Besides the basic Plat Form, Den-O can change his aura armor depending on which Imagin is in possession, altering his style: Sword Form with hot-headed [[Momotaros]] (red, default), Rod Form with smooth-talking [[Urataros]] (blue), Axe Form with boisterous [[Kintaros]] (yellow), Gun Form with cheerful [[Ryutaros]] (violet), and (to a lesser extent) Wing Form with princely [[Sieg]] (white). He later earns two fusion forms: Climax and Liner Forms.

title: has_bad_revision
body:
A post with a [[revision]] at the source that is bad, and should not be uploaded.

There's a number of more specific tags that can also be used:

* [[has artifacted revision]]
* [[has cropped revision]]
* [[has censored revision]]
* [[has downscaled revision]]
* [[has lossy revision]]
* [[has watermarked revision]]
* [[has adversarial noise revision]]

Note that this tag is supposed to be used on image that are already tagged with [[md5 mismatch]], [i]not[/i] on revisions that are actually already uploaded. Images that use this tag should also have some amount of visual identity or sameness to the revision at source, and this should not be tagged on images that have actual revisions even if they are smaller resolution (post #2561932, post #2749109) or deficient in other respects. In other words, the deficiency should be the [i]only[/i] change between the image on Danbooru and the revision at the source.

See [[md5 mismatch]] for more information on uploading revisions.

h4. See also

* [[image sample]]

title: honglan_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Park Ji-yoon]] (Korean) | [[Yukana]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A dragon girl who's usually seen playing around with either clouds or her pet rabbits. She may appear like an airheaded eccentric at first glance, she is one of the Four Guardians of Gaon, a group comprised of four formidable Souls each guarding the north, south, east, and west territories of Gaon from external threats. She has domain over ice and can employ the help of an ice dragon during her battles.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Green Dragon Crescent Blade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Dragon_Crescent_Blade][/i].

title: hazel_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Yang Jeong-hwa (Korean)
[hr]
Crown Princess of the Tabrian Empire, a militaristic nation ruled by the Great Empress Brigid and the ethos of "might makes right." She is a formidable commander in battle, leading her troops in such a calculated fashion, as if she was a conductor in an orchestra. She also has trouble expressing her emotions, especially towards those she holds dearly like her sister [[Edith_(eversoul)|]], as well as a very weak tolerance to cheese and alcohol.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Astrape":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astrape_and_Bronte][/i].

title: haru_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Gwak Gyu-mi (Korean) | [[Koyama Momoyo]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A fox girl working as a Forest Keeper for the Fayren Union. She was raised by two Soul Animals, a female "summer fox" and a male "winter wolf", in an unnamed snowy mountain until their recent passing due to Mana exhaustion, prompting her move to Fayren. Generally introverted and unsociable due to her battle style as a stealth-focused fighter. While she does say she can handle being alone for long periods of time, she does enjoy others' company, even if she doesn't physically show it.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Kutune Shirka":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kutune_Shirka][/i].

title: garnet_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Ga-ryung (Korean) | Kanno Mai (Japanese)
[hr]
A childish hopeless romantic at first glance, this hides her true identity of being a high-ranking member of Duchess [[Sigrid_(eversoul)|]]'s Nightbloods, an elite task force that enforces Sigrid's "rules" onto the lawless Tabrian underground Night City. A classic [[yandere]] character, she falls for the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]] at first sight and is very possessive of him, with her willingness to murder her "competition" being one of his main concerns about her.

Her associated artifact is the [i]"Spear of Longinus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_Lance[/i].

title: flynn_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Jang Mi (Korean) | [[Shintani Mayumi]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A genius but reckless hyena-like pyromaniac from the Republic of Chalar. Usually seen in her disheveled look, she's always spotted with an explosion or two nearby, earning her the ire of the general populace, not like she really cares about her reputation. Her dream is to create the greatest explosion the world has ever seen, a massive escalation of her initial dream of [spoiler]creating the most explosive fireworks the world has ever seen until she realized people don't really care all that much about "harmless" fireworks anyway, sowing seeds of insecurity and desire to be validated by someone[/spoiler].

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"RPG-7":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RPG-7][/i].

title: bullet_man
body:
A series of metallic statues resembling helmeted, nude men, displayed in front of the Alpensia Ski Jumping Center in Pyeongchang, South Korea. The statues reached memetic status in Japan during the 2018 [[Olympics]], where a broadcast featured them as an establishing shot of the center.

The Japanese net quickly warmed up to them, giving them the nickname "Morugessoyo" (ãƒ¢ãƒ«ã‚²ãƒƒã‚½ãƒ¨; a transliterated version of [i]moreugesseoyo[/i], Korean for "I don't know"), and were also later used as a materials for the [[petrification]] works.

title: coughing
body:
A reflex to clear the windpipe, usually caused by respiratory infections or diseases. Differs from [[sneezing]] in that it usually repeats many times and aims to clear the windpipe of fluid and blockages rather than "to scratch an itch."

h4. See also

* [[asphyxiation]]
* [[asthma]]
* [[choking on object]]
* [[coughing blood]]
* [[drowning]]
* [[hiccup]]
* [[strangling]]
* [[sneezing]]

title: hiccup
body:
An involuntary contraction of the diaphragm, usually caused by certain stimulus in one's esophagus. Typically results in a "hic" sound.

h4. See also
* [[Coughing]]

title: palpatine
body:
The ultimate [[Sith]] Master, [b]Sheev Palpatine[/b], also known as [b]Darth Sidious[/b] is the overarching antagonist of the [[Star Wars]] saga. 

The sinister Emperor of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], Palpatine is truly powerful in the Dark Side of the Force, a very cunning manipulator, utterly treacherous to those he deals with, and very cruel and merciless even to his own underlings.

Sith Master of [[Darth Vader]].

title: uzuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Uzuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink_hair|pink hair]] with [[antenna hair]], and [[pink_eyes|pink]]/[[red_eyes|red eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent hair ornament|crescent]] and [[rabbit hair ornament]]s, [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with white stripes, and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back (with [[cherry blossoms]] attached), a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

h4. Appearance

title: kikuzuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kikuzuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent pin]] on a [[brown belt]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and a [[depth charge]] to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles. 

h4. Appearance

title: snk_heroines:_tag_team_frenzy
body:
[[SNK]] fighting game featuring various SNK heroines in 2 on 2 fighting action, released in summer [[2018]] for the [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[PlayStation 4|PS4]] with a side focus on dressing up the heroines in various customizable alternate outfits.

A spiritual successor to the Neo-Geo Pocket game [[SNK Gals Fighters]].

title: bra_strap
body:
When only the straps of a [[bra]] are visible. Most common instances of this occurring is when a bra is worn underneath a [[strapless]] garment or an [[off shoulder]] [[off-shoulder shirt|shirt]]/[[off-shoulder dress|dress]]/[[off-shoulder sweater|sweater]].

Do not use if the entire bra is fully or mostly visible, or if the character is only wearing a bra on their torso.

h4. Examples

* !post #7560972
* !post #7455979
* !post #6646647
* !post #8386029

h4.Incorrect examples

* !post #7924714: Bra is fully visible
* !post #8377570

h4. See also

* [[bra peek]]
* [[garter straps]]
* [[panty straps]]
* [[strap slip]]

title: multi-strapped_bra
body:

title: multi-strapped_bikini_top
body:
A [[bikini]] top with multiple shoulder straps, or a combination of both a [[halterneck]] and shoulder straps.

Don't confuse with [[layered bikini]] or [[eyepatch bikini]].

h4. See also

* [[multi-strapped bikini bottom]]
* [[multi-strapped bra]]

title: multi-strapped_bikini_bottom
body:
A [[bikini]] bottom with multiple waist straps. Sometimes seen with [[bikini skirt]]s with extra straps in addition to the skirt waistband.

If it's two distinct bikini bottoms worn on top of each other, rather than a single piece, use [[layered bikini]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[multi-strapped bikini top]]
* [[multi-strapped panties]]
